overview: In this work Natalia LL impersonates for the first time Brunhilde – a character from Nordic mythology, the heroine of the opera Valkyrie by Richard Wagner, the artist’s favourite composer. Through the brave heroine she talks about the transience, ultimate matters, meeting of Eros and Tanatos. She uses a banana, a symbol of sexuality familiar from her earlier works, as well as kales and skulls, well-known symbols of death.
title: Brunhild's Dreams
